result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Don Henderson

records.addlTxt: Letter from defendant.  (Michael D. Henderson, Milwaukee County Jail - Pod 5C/25, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).

Defendant Michael Don Henderson in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Defendant Michael Don Henderson in custody.  Emily S Zimmel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Scheduling conference held.  Defense requests a final pretrial and jury trial date.  Parties advised any motion are to be filed by October 1, 2022.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for January 17, 2023 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Heather Johnson requested adjournment, via email, due to being in Trial in another Court.  No objection from State.  Court grants adjournment.  Both parties agreed to new Scheduling Conference date, via email.  Case scheduled for Scheduling Conference July 11, 2022, at 8:30 am.

Defendant Michael Don Henderson in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Defendant Michael Don Henderson in custody.  Emily S Zimmel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: nk 
Case in Court for Status and Bail/Bond Hearing.  Court denies motion for bail reduction; Bail remains the same.  Defense request time for review.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael Don Henderson in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Defendant Michael Don Henderson in custody.  BOTH APPEARED BY VIDEO. Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Detective Paul Miner MPD..   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Defense request to be heard as to Bail.  Case is adjourned to Branch 12.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael Don Henderson in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Defendant Michael Don Henderson in custody.  Emily S Zimmel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Case calendared for State v Lee Hearing.  Attorney Heather Johnson appointed to represent the Defendant.  Case adjourned for Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
State Public Defender - Order Appointing Counsel received and filed.  bm

Defendant Michael Don Henderson not in court, defendant in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is in a training. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a State V. Lee hearing in the trial court.  Hearing scheduled for April 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael Don Henderson not in court, defendant in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Michael Don Henderson not in court, defendant in custody.  John Daniel Flynn appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ZMG; CSW

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring; no contact order.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list.

Defendant Michael Don Henderson in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Michael Don Henderson in custody.  amy E spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Michael Don Henderson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Borowski, Branch 12.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a Preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.   DEFENDANT QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
